name: places/ChIJkYLm_QP0wokRfdQHXQkIPJc

displayName.text: City College Academy of the Arts

adrFormatAddress: 4600 Broadway, New York, NY 10040-2102, USA

originalText.text: I'm going to the seventh grade. So far in the sixth grade my teachers have been very supportive and I hope that my seventh grade teachers would be as supportive this is definitely the school that you would want your children to go to. There is no bullying in this school. You would see some fights but never any taunting. Maximum you would see at least three fights in the whole year. If anybody is ever bullying you or your child all you have to do is talk to the guidance counselor or the principal and actions would be made as soon as they hear it. Another thing that I love is that you are always friends with the principal. Yes the teachers are strict but they give you a lot of chances which works out for the best. CCAA  is a good school what I mentioned is only half of the great things.

originalText.text: This is a great school! I have been there since 6th grade I graduated with the help of all the staff and now I'm in college. Go Hawks!!

text.text: This is a great school! I have been there since 6th grade I graduated with the help of all the staff and now I'm in college. Go Hawks!!

originalText.text: The prinicpal and staffs of this school are rude, disrespectful, and have a disgusting attitude. This school is so unorganized, both offices on the 1st and 4th floor sometimes have no employees or anyone to attend you, the security guard is rude as well and over the phone staffs have terrible attitude and service. Very unprofessional school, do not bring your kids here.

text.text: The prinicpal and staffs of this school are rude, disrespectful, and have a disgusting attitude. This school is so unorganized, both offices on the 1st and 4th floor sometimes have no employees or anyone to attend you, the security guard is rude as well and over the phone staffs have terrible attitude and service. Very unprofessional school, do not bring your kids here.

originalText.text:
well i just graduated from there in june 2013, i was there from 6th grade to 12th grade. everyone says its a bad school, but its actually not. how cool would it be to receive your bachelors degree at 20 years old? once you into the 9th grade you start taking college credit classes at the high school but when you get to 10th grade you start to take actually classes at the college , its amazing, you take morning classes at the high school then half way through out the day you get to leave eat lunch and then go take classes on 137th and amsterdam. the only way to keep going to the college is by keeping good grades. once you get to 11th grade you go to the college in the morning and take about one or two classes at the high school in the afternoon. once you become a senior, you take classes all day at the college, leave early , take two - three classes a day. its cool. if you go to the highschool in your senior year its wasteless, you barely participate in senior activities. BUT REMEMBER TO HAVE GOOD GRADES. the guidance counselour is amazing, ms almanzar, ive known her my WHOLE life.
yes theres uniform but if you go to the college you dont have to wear uniform, the uniform is purple or white collared shirts with gray pants or skirts. its basically your small family , everyone is very united. ive never noticed any bullies and if someone does bully you, ignore them, they hate it.

originalText.text: I mean I never been in city college  because I'm in fith grade but just by looking at the pictures of the uniform makes me have nausea because  it really bothers me and I would give the school 5 stars if they change the uniform into whatever  clothing  you want to ware.Its more comfortable if we get whatever clothes we Want to ware right
